channel.title: Not sure if this is the right place but
channel.description: I need help with gtl vote I put localhost for the host address the first time and the server compiles and runs with no errors then the website gives an error saying that the user root was not found on localhost.

item.title: Not sure if this is the right place but
item.dc:creator: @suseto suseto
item.description:
@suseto wrote:

No I’m not sure if localhost was the right address, but it was the only one that worked. As far as phpadmin I don’t know my way around it enough to tell. So i’m not sure I could tell you.

Edit: The gtl voting is working except for one thing the user selects a reward and they get the one above this i believe is server sided.

Read full topic
item.source: Not sure if this is the right place but

item.title: Not sure if this is the right place but
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Technically, this is a website issue.
Here’s a quick guide to explain how to tell the difference:

Is your RuneScape SERVER showing an error, compiling and showing an error, or is it sending an error to the client?
Then it’s a server-related issue and belongs in the Server Help section.

Is your RuneScape CLIENT showing an error, compiling and showing an error, not loading, or freezing?
Then it’s client-related and goes in the Client Help section.

Are you trying to modify something in the CACHE, the maps/objects/models/players/npcs/etc not showing, a sprite not working/showing, a button not working/showing, or an interface not working/showing?
Then it’s client-related and goes in the Client Help section. (There are no Cache sections… Client reads the cache data anyways).

Is it an error displaying on your website, an error in your website’s logfiles, or something on your website not displaying correctly?
Then it’s website-related and belongs in the Web Design/Development section.

[hr]
As for your issue: Are you sure that you needed to set “localhost” as the database IP? And double check what accounts exist in your phpMyAdmin

Read full topic
